msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [n]

objectDesc.p: Parchment, 26x21.5, 407 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 32-34 line(s) per column, 18-37 characters per line, written in Greek/Latin.

handDesc.handNote: 375-499 Original scribe with professional hand (4201 verses).

additions.p: There were several other correctors after the terminus ad quem.

history.provenance: Transferred 800-899 to Monastère Saint Irénée (Saint Irenaeus Monastery) at Lyon, France where it was repaired.
Transferred 1562 to Theodore Beza at Genève, Schweiz during the French wars when Lyons fell to the Huguenots.
Transferred 1581 to Cambridge University Library at Cambridge, England.

msIdentifier.msName: Nn. 2. 41, Cambridge University Library, Cambridge, England.

sourceDesc.bibl: Scrivener, Frederick H., Bezae Codex Cantabrigiensis, Deighton, Bell, and Co.: Cambridge, England, 1864. OCLC 43167258.
